result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sirron O Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Sirron O
defendant.address: c/o Wood County Jail  400 Market Street, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court notes that competency report indicates that defendant is now competent to proceed.
Attorney Slattery states that he is not contesting doctor's report and feels defendant is competent. Attorney Lambert states he has no evidence to the contrary.
Court questions defendant and feels that he is competent. Court finds that defendant is now competent to proceed.
Matter will be set for FPT. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records w/ Competency Report
Order for Competency Examination of Department of Health Services
Order for Competency Examination of Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Slattery is requesting a competency evaluation. State has no comment.
Court orders competency evaluation. Attorney Slattery will draft order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson. 
Not guilty plea. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He has not contacted Public Defender's Office. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Ross Schultz is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Oswald. On 5/15/22, he was dispatched to the Wood County Jail due an incident between two inmates. He made contact with ESG and he stated that he had turned down the TV in his cell block and the defendant threw a remote at the TV and threw a tablet on the ground and defendant followed him and hit him in the face. He observed injuries on his face. He reviewed video surveillance which confirmed ESG's statement. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:53 PM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
